author: adityapatwardhan
body: Package management tests disabled temporarily to unblock daily builds.

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
I think it's better to use a file-level try-finally to disable them.
We had a similar discussion in #2335 and agreed that BeforeAll/AfterAll disabling is too verbose, if we do it for the whole file.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @adityapatwardhan If we are just temporarily disabling those tests, wouldn't it be much easier to just `return` at the beginning of those test files? And then it would also be much easier to re-enable those tests after moving them to oneget.org (just remove the `return` at the beginning of each test file).

comments.author: vors
comments.body: @daxian-dbw that way we get reporting about skipped / pending tests and it's useful.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @vors Yes, but we are removing them from PS/PS, so it's doesn't matter that we don't keep track of skipping/pending for them. BTW, I chatted with @adityapatwardhan and learnt that @jianyunt asked him to directly delete those tests from PS/PS, which is even better.

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
Tests are deleted in the different PR.
I think this PR is obsolete now.

title: Disable PackageManagementTests
